official-title.#text: To authorize the House of Representatives and the Senate to bring an action seeking declaratory and injunctive relief in response to the failure of the President to meet the requirement of the Constitution to faithfully execute the law, and for other purposes.

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Authorization of House and Senate to bring action in response to failure of the President to execute the law

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the President has failed to meet the requirement of section 3 of article II of the Constitution of the United States to take care that a law be faithfully executed, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Enforce the Take Care Clause Act of 2014/s:2/ss:b

may bring an action (in the name of the
or the
, as the case may be) seeking declaratory and injunctive relief to compel the President to faithfully execute that law.

text.#text: Upon the adoption of a resolution declaring that, on the basis of any of the Presidential actions described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or the
shall not be considered to have adopted a resolution under this section unless the resolution is approved by not fewer than 60 percent of the members present and voting.

text.#text: The Presidential actions described in this subsection are as follows:
The promulgation of a regulation or agency administrative guidance.
The issuance of an Executive order, including an order to not defend a challenge to the constitutionality of a law and an order to not enforce a law.
The issuance of a signing statement with respect to the enactment of a law.

with full recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change the rules (so far as relating to the procedure of that House) at any time, in the same manner, and to the same extent as in the case of any other rule of that House.

text.#text: The following rules shall apply with respect to any action brought by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , and shall be heard not later than 30 days after the action is filed by a 3-judge court convened pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District Court for the District of Columbia

(in the case of an action brought by the

text.#text: A copy of the complaint shall be delivered promptly to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . Such appeal shall be taken by the filing of a notice of appeal within 10 days, and the filing of a jurisdictional statement within 30 days, of the entry of the final decision.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Supreme Court of the United States

text.#text: A final decision in the action shall be issued not later than 90 days after the action is filed and shall be reviewable only by appeal directly to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States District Court for the District of Columbia
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: District Court for the District of Columbia

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to advance on the docket and to expedite to the greatest possible extent the disposition of the action and appeal.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Supreme Court of the United States

text.#text: It shall be the duty of the
